titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Anna Gurton-Wachter. Finding aid completed by Sophie Glidden-Lyon and Sana Masood.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-04-03T16:27-0400

did.abstract: Marion Nestle is a nutritionist, consumer activist, and academic who is one of the pioneers of the food movement. Nestle is Paulette Goddard Professor in the Department of Nutrition, Food Studies, and Public Health at New York University, which she chaired from 1988-2003. Her research examines scientific and socioeconomic influences on food choice, obesity, and food safety, emphasizing the role of food marketing. She is the author of eight books, including Food Politics: How the Food Industry Influences Nutrition and Health; What to Eat; and, with Dr. Malden Nesheim, Why Calories Count: From Science to Politics.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: The Marion Nestle Papers collection was processed even as Nestle continued to donate her vast book collection to the Fales Library. For the most part, Nestle's book library has been catalogued separately from the personal papers. Books that remain in the collection are either annotated or appeared to be directly relevant to the surrounding printed material. A related name search in Bobcat under "Cecily Brownstone" will retrieve records for the entire library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Marion Nestle Papers are organized into fourteen series. Within these series, files are arranged both alphabetically by subject/author heading and chronologically depending on the nature of the series. Descriptions are at the folder level. The Series are as follows:

Series I: Food Politics
Series II: Safe Food
Series III: What to Eat
Series IV: Pet Food Politics
Series V: Feed Your Pet Right
Series VI: Why Calories Count
Series VII: Professional Activities
Series VIII: Press
Series IX: Photographs
Series X: Printed Material
Series XI: Media
Series XII: Data Storage
Series XIII: Objects
Series XIV: Oversize

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Marion Nestle is a nutritionist, consumer advocate, and academic whose research examines scientific and socioeconomic influences on food choice, obesity, and food safety, emphasizing the role of food marketing. She is the author of eight books, including Food Politics: How the Food Industry Influences Nutrition and Health; What to Eat; and, with Dr. Malden Nesheim, Feed Your Pet Right and Why Calories Count: From Science to Politics. A ninth book, Soda Politics, is scheduled for publication in 2015.

After completing a Bachelor's Degree in Bacteriology at the University of California Berkeley in 1959, Nestle went to earn a PhD in Molecular Biology in 1968 and an MPH in Public Health Nutrition in 1986, also from UC Berkeley. She is Paulette Goddard Professor in the Department of Nutrition, Food Studies, and Public Health at New York University, which she chaired from 1988-2003. From 2008 to 2013, she wrote Food Matters, a monthly food column in the San Francisco Chronicle.

Nestle received an honorary Doctor of Science degree from Transylvania University in 2012, and a James Beard Leadership Award in 2013, among many other awards. She has appeared as an expert in numerous films, including Super Size Me, Food Fight, and In Organic We Trust. In 2011, the University of California School of Public Health at Berkeley declared her a "Public Heath Hero." In Forbes magazine, food writer Michael Pollan named Nestle the "the world's #2 most powerful foodie," calling her "an indispensable voice on the problems of the American diet and their roots in industry marketing and government policy." New York Times writer Mark Bittman has described Nestle as "the #1 foodie to be thankful for," calling her an "all-around heroine" and noting that "many of those involved in the food movement [started] with Marion Nestle."
She has run a blog and web site, foodpolitics.com, since 2006 and a twitter account, @marionnestle, since 2009.

p.extref: Les Dames d'Escoffier New York Archive
Voices from the Food Revolution: People Who Changed The Way Americans Eat
Noel Riley Fitch Julia Child Papers

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); Marion Nestle Papers; MSS 159; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: NYU's Fales Library & Special Collections is not the copyright owner for this collection. Collection use is subject to all copyright laws. Researchers wishing to reproduce collection material should contact rights holders for permission.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open to researchers. Appointments are necessary for the use of manuscript and archival collections.
Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Marion Nestle Papers document Marion Nestle's career as an author, public figure, and professor in the nutrition, food studies, and public health fields. The collection primarily consists of materials involved in the creation of her books, including Nestle's notes, research files, correspondence, book tour plans, and book drafts. Printed materials including restaurant menus, and food event flyers, and conference programs comprise another significant component of the collection. Nestle's correspondence with other authors, professors, and individuals from the food studies movement as well as materials from her professional roles as the senior nutritionist at the Surgeon General, as a teacher at New York University, the University of California at Berkeley and San Francisco, and as a lecturer at food-related events, colloquia, and symposia constitute a smaller part of the collection. Nestle's role as an editorial reviewer and advisor appear in the correspondence and printed materials she collected. The bulk of Nestle's research files span the years 1980-2013.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: The collection was donated to NYU's Fales Library & Special Collections in several stages by Marion Nestle between 2004 and 2013.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Series I contains materials relating the writing of the book Food Politics which was published in 2002. Materials include drafts, editing notes, book tour information, an abridged version for audio book, and research files.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Material in Subseries A are arranged chronologically and reflect the editing date labeled by Marion Nestle.

arrangement.p: Material has been arranged alphabetically by subject and reflect the original folder titles provided by Marion Nestle.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Series II contains material related to the writing of the book Safe Food first published in 2003 and then revised and expanded in 2010.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series II has been arranged into three subseries: Drafts, Biotechnology Research Files, and Food Safety Research Files. The division of reserach files into either Biotechnology reserach or Food Safety reserach is one that Marion Nestle created and reflects her original research schema. Each subseries is described in greater detail below.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials are arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Series VII contains material relating to Marion Nestle's professional life. This includes articles authored by her, material related to her teaching such as course evaluations, books she was asked to review, correspondence, awards and her day planners.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series VII is arranged into seven subseries, divided by her various professional activities. More information on the arrangment within the subseries can be found below.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Subseries D: Reviewed Books is comprised of manuscripts, advanced reading copies, and galleys for editorial and advisory review by Marion Nestle. Comments and correspondence with publishers regarding these books can be found in Subseries D: Correspondence.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Material arrived together with no apparent order. The archivist arranged all books and manuscripts by surname of the author.

arrangement.p: Series IX is arranged chronologically, in groups dictated by original order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series includes various photographs from Marion Nestle’s professional life. It is comprised of head shots as well as photographs from the Surgeon General's Report event in July 1988, a Proctor & Gamble Press Conference in October 1988, Mexico City in 1997, a photo shoot with Claudia Schiffer for Self Magazine in February 1999, "Career Day" events from Spring 1995 and November 1996, construction of the kitchen at the Education Building on 35 W. 4th Street, and a graduation party from May 1998. The series also contains the negatives of some of these photographs as well as negatives from photographs not included in the series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Series X: Printed Materials consists of annual reports, catalogues, programs, professional handbooks, newsletters, postcards, marketing packages, magazines and annotated books. Included in this series are research materials that were not clearly identified with any of her books. Periodicals and USDA Publications have been identified as separate subseries and are described further below.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials are arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Subseries A: USDA Publications contains a complete edition of the United States Department of Agriculture’s Composition of Foods. A few other smaller USDA Publications are also included.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Material has been arranged into two subseries comprising of video and audio.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Series XI: Media is comprised of video and audio materials featuring Marion Nestle or relating to food studies.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Material is separated into VHS tapes and DVDs and arranged alphabetically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Series XIII: Objects consists of awards Marion Nestle won and is majority plaques.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: The materials are processed at box level.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Series XIV: Oversize contains oversize materials collected by Marion Nestle including posters, newspapers, awards, and a children's cutting board.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Material is arranged chronologically.
